  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller()

  • Method Details

    • testCases

      public void testCases()
      The function initializes and adds test cases for users and products.

    • getUserList

      public String getUserList()
      The function returns a formatted string containing a list of users' IDs and names.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that contains a list of users, where each user is represented by their ID and name. The list is created by iterating over the `users` list and concatenating the user information to the `msg` variable. The method then returns the `msg` variable.

    • registerUser

      public boolean registerUser(String name, String nickname, int userType, int userCategory)
      This function registers a new user with a generated ID, name, nickname, user type, and user category.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the user being registered.
      nickname - The nickname parameter is a String that represents the chosen username or alias of the user being registered.
      userType - An integer value representing the type of user being registered. A value of 1 indicates a regular user, while any other value indicates a premium user.
      userCategory - The userCategory parameter is an integer that represents the category of a Premium user. The specific categories and their corresponding integer values would need to be defined elsewhere in the code.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value indicating whether the user was successfully added to the list of users or not.

    • generateHexId

      public String generateHexId()
      This Java function generates a unique hexadecimal ID by randomly selecting three hexadecimal digits and checking if it already exists in a list of users.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String value which is a randomly generated hexadecimal ID that is not already present in the list of existing user IDs.

    • editUser

      public boolean editUser(int userPosition, String name, int category)
      The function edits a user's name and category, with the category being set to SILVER, GOLD, or DIAMOND based on the input integer value.
      Parameters:
      userPosition - The position of the user in the list of users that needs to be edited.
      name - A string representing the new name for the user being edited.
      category - An integer representing the category of the user. It can be 0, 1, 2, or 3. 0 represents a regular user, while 1, 2, and 3 represent premium users with different levels of membership.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the user was successfully edited or not.

    • deleteUser

      public boolean deleteUser(int userPosition)
      This Java function deletes a user from a list of users at a specified position and returns a boolean value indicating whether the deletion was successful.
      Parameters:
      userPosition - userPosition is an integer parameter that represents the position of the user to be deleted from a list or array. The method removes the user at the specified position from the list and returns true if the deletion is successful.
      Returns:
      A boolean value of true is being returned.

    • getUserInfo

      public String getUserInfo(int option)
      The function returns user information and their category if they are a premium user.
      Parameters:
      option - an integer representing the index of the user in the "users" list whose information is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A string containing information about a user, including their basic information and, if they are a Premium user, their category. The specific user whose information is returned is determined by the "option" parameter passed to the method.

    • countAllUserInfo

      public String countAllUserInfo()
      The function counts the number of users in different categories and returns a message with the count for each category.
      Returns:
      A String message containing the count of different types of users (regular and premium) and the count of premium users in each category (silver, gold, and diamond). If there are no users, an empty string is returned.

    • getTypeOfUser

      public boolean getTypeOfUser(int option)
      This function checks if a user is of type "Regular" based on the option selected.
      Parameters:
      option - an integer representing the index of a user in a list of users.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value. If the user at the specified index in the "users" list is an instance of the "Regular" class, the method returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.

    • registerProduct

      public boolean registerProduct(String name, int numOfPages, int typeOfProduct, String review, int genre, double price, int categoryChoose, double subscribeCost, String broadCastPeriodicity)
      This function registers a new product (either a book or a magazine) with various attributes and adds it to a list of products.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the product being registered (either a book or a magazine).
      numOfPages - The number of pages of the product being registered.
      typeOfProduct - an integer representing the type of product being registered (1 for book, 2 for magazine)
      review - A string representing the review of the product.
      genre - an integer representing the genre of the book (1 for science fiction, 2 for fantasy, 3 for historical novel)
      price - The price parameter is a double data type and represents the cost of the product being registered.
      categoryChoose - an integer representing the category chosen for a magazine (1 for VARIETIES, 2 for DESIGN, 3 for SCIENCE)
      subscribeCost - The cost of subscribing to the magazine.
      broadCastPeriodicity - The frequency at which the magazine is published or broadcasted, such as weekly, monthly, or quarterly.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value indicating whether the product (either a Book or a Magazine) was successfully added to the list of products.

    • getProductList

      public String getProductList()
      This function returns a formatted string containing the list of products, including their ID, name, and type (book or magazine).
      Returns:
      The method `getProductList` returns a `String` containing a list of products, their IDs, names, and types (either "Book" or "Magazine").

    • getTypeOfProduct

      public boolean getTypeOfProduct(int option)
      This function checks if a product at a given option is an instance of a Book and returns a boolean value accordingly.
      Parameters:
      option - The index of the product in the "products" list that we want to check the type of.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if the product at the specified option in the products list is an instance of the Book class, and false otherwise.

    • editProduct

      public boolean editProduct(int userPosition, String name, String url, double price, String broadCastPeriodicity, int typeOfProduct, int option2, int option3)
      This function edits a product's name, URL, price, or other attributes based on the type of product and user-selected options.
      Parameters:
      userPosition - The index position of the product in the ArrayList that needs to be edited.
      name - The new name of the product that the user wants to edit.
      url - A string representing the URL of a product.
      price - The price of the product that needs to be edited.
      broadCastPeriodicity - The frequency at which a magazine is published or broadcasted, such as weekly, monthly, or quarterly.
      typeOfProduct - An integer representing the type of product being edited. 1 represents a book and 2 represents a magazine.
      option2 - This parameter is used to determine which attribute of a Book object needs to be edited.
      option3 - An integer representing the option selected for editing a product of type Magazine.
      Returns:
      The method returns a boolean value indicating whether the product was successfully edited or not.

    • deleteProduct

      public boolean deleteProduct(int productPosition)
      This Java function deletes a product from a list of products at a specified position and returns a boolean value indicating whether the deletion was successful.
      Parameters:
      productPosition - The parameter productPosition is an integer that represents the position of the product to be deleted from the list of products.
      Returns:
      A boolean value of true is being returned.

    • showBooks

      public String showBooks()
      The function returns a string containing a list of books with their IDs and names.
      Returns:
      The method `showBooks()` returns a `String` that contains a numbered list of all the books in the `products` list.

    • buyBooks

      public String buyBooks(int position, String id)
      This function buys a book from a specific position in a list of products and updates the user's information accordingly.
      Parameters:
      position - The position of the book in the list of products (starting from 1).
      id - The ID of the user who wants to buy a book.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a message (String) indicating whether the book was bought successfully or not.

    • showMagazines

      public String showMagazines()
      This function returns a string containing a list of all magazines in the system.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that contains a list of all the magazines in the system, with their corresponding ID and name. If there are no magazines in the system, the method returns a message indicating that there are no magazines registered.

    • subscribeMagazine

      public String subscribeMagazine(int position, String id)
      This Java function subscribes a user to a magazine at a specified position and returns a message indicating success or failure.
      Parameters:
      position - The position of the magazine in the products list that the user wants to subscribe to.
      id - The ID of the user who wants to subscribe to a magazine.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a message (String) indicating whether the magazine subscription was completed properly or not.

    • searchUser

      public boolean searchUser(String id)
      This Java function searches for a user in a list of users by their ID and returns true if found, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      id - The parameter "id" is a String representing the user ID that we want to search for in the "users" list.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if the input id matches the id of any user in the users list, and false otherwise.

    • lookUpUserPosition

      public int lookUpUserPosition(String id)
      This Java function looks up the position of a user in a list of users based on their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The parameter "id" is a String variable that represents the unique identifier of a user. The method "lookUpUserPosition" takes this parameter as input and returns the position of the user in the "users" list.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value which represents the position of a user in the list of users. If the user with the given ID is found in the list, the method returns the index of that user in the list. If the user is not found, the method returns -1.

    • showLibrary

      public String showLibrary(String id)
      The function returns a message containing the library of a user, organized by date and filled with products, depending on whether the user is a premium or regular user.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the user whose library is being requested.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that shows the library of a user with the given id. If the user is a Premium user, the library is organized by date and filled with the Premium method, and if the user is a Regular user, the library is organized by date and filled with the Regular method. If the user has not purchased any products, the method returns a message saying so.

    • lectureSimulator

      public String lectureSimulator(String id, String bookChoosed, int page, String userChoice, int count)
      This function simulates a reading experience for a user, including navigating pages and displaying messages, and may display advertisements for non-premium users.
      Parameters:
      id - A String representing the user's ID.
      bookChoosed - The ID of the book chosen by the user.
      page - The current page the user is on in the book.
      userChoice - A string representing the user's choice of action in the lecture simulator. It can be either "A" to go back one page or "S" to go forward one page.
      count - The count parameter is an integer that represents the number of times the lecture simulator method has been called.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message.

    • acumReadedPagesPerProduct

      public String acumReadedPagesPerProduct()
      The function calculates the total number of pages read for books and magazines in a list of products.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that indicates the total number of pages read for books and magazines in the products list.

    • genreAndCategoryMoreReaded

      public String genreAndCategoryMoreReaded()
      This function calculates and returns the most read genre and category of books and magazines respectively.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that indicates the most read genre and category among the products (books and magazines) in the store.

    • top5

      public String top5()
      The function returns the top 5 books and magazines based on the number of pages read.
      Returns:
      A String message containing the top 5 books and top 5 magazines based on the accumulated number of pages read.

    • genreResume

      public String genreResume()
      The function generates a resume of the sales and total value of books sold by genre.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that contains information about the sales of books in different genres, including the number of units sold and the total value of sales for each genre.

    • categoryResume

      public String categoryResume()
      The function calculates and returns the number of active subscriptions and the value of subscriptions sold for each category of magazine.
      Returns:
      The method `categoryResume()` returns a `String` message containing information about the number of active subscriptions and the value collected from subscriptions for each category of magazines (varieties, science, and design).
